A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
"Sometimes feeding the fan base isn't that bad"

It is what makes The force awakens work! This movie does not do this. It kills everything that the original story is and for one purpose: To make more movies; Did we expect less? Where the first in this trilogy serviced the fandom and played on nostalgia this movie rips it all away in the name of pushing politics and creating a new fan base. Yes\, this movie had high expectations\, but by doing what they have Disney has solidified the future of this franchise with it's PC message and killing off all links to the meat and potatoes of the Star Wars universe. Goal of making money accomplished. 

This move will make you enjoy the prequels! At least the Star Wars feeling is there and the homage to the importance of special individuals being picked (Jedi Council) being chosen to protect the order of the Republic by being gatekeepers of freedom. 

This episode literally says: The Jedi were the defenders of nothing and that they were not special and that everyone is special... ugh.... puh-lease.... Along with forced comedy with characters that cannot pass it off as natural enough\, it worked for Han Solo because of the Actor and the role in which he was. A space Pirate/smuggler\, would you expect anything less?

The action sequences were the only redeeming quality\, but it is 2017 so no surprises there.

Episode IX has so much ground to make up and really has the power to make or break this for the future of the franchise. The only way to move forward would be to explore the POSSIBILITY that by using both the light and dark sides of the force only then can the galaxy reach balance. I hope this is what they were attempting to explain with the moral conflict in Rey and Kylo\, but with a film this shallow I doubt it.

See it once and hope for IX to be the reboot to revitalize deep characters that you actually care about and are invested in.
